Description: A tall, wooden shabti-box with 3 flat sides remaining; the fourth is missing, as is the base and lid. The exterior is painted with scenes and text in yellow paint on a black ground. On the front is a scene showing representations of Anubis and a bull-headed god on either side of the symbol of Abydos. There are ten columns of hieroglyphic text above, surmountde by a sky-hieroglyph with yellow stars, and a border horizontal line of hieroglyphs along the top edge of the box. One side bears figures of four human-headed deities holding knives and facing to the front. The other shoes Atum, Hathor and two other divinities, the last crocodile-headed. Above the figures on both sides are ten vertical columns of hierogyphic text below a sky-sign, with a horizontal kine of text above.
Cultures/periods: 26th Dynasty (Date: See Gill 2019b with further references)
Bibliographic references: Gill 2019b / The funerary papyri of the brothers Djedher and Pakherkhonsu in the Museo Egizio and the British Museum with some observations on scribal practices
